name: central_angles_congruent_arcs
problem: If central angles are congruent, then the corresponding arcs are congruent.

name: congruent_arcs_central_angles
problem: If arcs are congruent, then the corresponding central angles are congruent.

name: triangle_angle_sum
problem: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180°.

name: exterior_angle_triangle
problem: Any exterior angle of a triangle is congruent to the sum of the interior angles not supplementary to it.

name: isosceles_triangle_base_angles
problem: In a triangle, if two sides are congruent, then the angles opposite those sides are congruent.

name: isosceles_triangle_sides
problem: In a triangle, if two angles are congruent, then the sides opposite those angles are congruent.

name: perpendicular_smaller_than_slant
problem: The perpendicular dropped from any point to a line is smaller than any slant drawn from the same point to this line.

name: perpendiculars_to_same_line_parallel
problem: Two perpendiculars to the same line are parallel to each other.

name: right_angle_intersection
problem: If one of the four angles formed by two intersecting lines is a right angle, then the other three angles are right angles.

name: divisibility_by_6
problem: If a number is divisible by 2 and by 3, then it is divisible by 6.

name: converse_divisibility_by_6
problem: If a number is divisible by 6, then it is divisible by 2 and by 3.

name: polygon_angle_sum
problem: The sum of the interior angles of a convex polygon with n sides is (n-2) × 180°.

name: polygon_exterior_angle_sum
problem: The sum of the exterior angles of any polygon is 360°.

name: isosceles_triangle_bisector_median_altitude
problem: In an isosceles triangle, the bisector of the angle at the vertex is also the median and the altitude.

name: isosceles_triangle_base_angles
problem: In an isosceles triangle, the angles at the base are congruent.

name: sas_congruence_test
problem: If two sides and the included angle of one triangle are congruent to two sides and the included angle of another triangle, then the triangles are congruent.

name: asa_congruence_test
problem: If two angles and the included side of one triangle are congruent to two angles and the included side of another triangle, then the triangles are congruent.

name: sss_congruence_test
problem: If three sides of one triangle are congruent to three sides of another triangle, then the triangles are congruent.

name: triangle_side_inequality
problem: The sum of any two sides of a triangle is greater than the third side.

name: triangle_angle_side_inequality
problem: In a triangle, the side opposite the larger angle is longer.

name: triangle_side_angle_inequality
problem: In a triangle, the angle opposite the longer side is larger.

name: right_triangle_altitude_geometric_mean
problem: In a right triangle, the altitude to the hypotenuse is the geometric mean of the segments into which it divides the hypotenuse.

name: right_triangle_leg_geometric_mean
problem: In a right triangle, each leg is the geometric mean of the hypotenuse and the segment of the hypotenuse adjacent to the leg.

name: circle_three_points
problem: Through any three non-collinear points, there is exactly one circle.

name: diameter_bisects_chord
problem: A diameter perpendicular to a chord bisects the chord and the arcs it subtends.

name: tangent_perpendicular_to_radius
problem: If a line is tangent to a circle, then the radius drawn to the point of tangency is perpendicular to the line.

name: perpendicular_to_radius_tangent
problem: If a line is perpendicular to a radius at its endpoint on the circle, then the line is tangent to the circle.

name: tangent_circles_line_of_centers
problem: If two circles are tangent, then the line of centers passes through the point of tangency.

name: intersecting_circles_perpendicular_bisector
problem: If two circles intersect, then the line of centers is the perpendicular bisector of the common chord.

name: common_point_tangent_circles
problem: If two circles have a common point on the line of centers, then they are tangent to each other.

name: tangent_circles_common_tangent
problem: If two circles are tangent, then the common tangent line at the point of tangency is perpendicular to the line of centers.

name: tangent_line_perpendicular_to_radius
problem: If a line is tangent to a circle, then the radius drawn to the point of tangency is perpendicular to the tangent line.

name: perpendicular_to_radius_tangent_line
problem: If a line is perpendicular to a radius at its endpoint on the circle, then the line is tangent to the circle.

problem: If two circles are tangent, then the line of centers passes through the point of tangency.

problem: If a line is tangent to a circle, then the radius drawn to the point of tangency is perpendicular to the tangent line.

name: perpendicular_to_radius_tangent_line
problem: If a line is perpendicular to a radius at its endpoint on the circle, then the line is tangent to the circle.

name: perpendicular_bisector_properties
problem: The perpendicular bisector of a segment is the locus of points equidistant from the endpoints of the segment.

name: angle_bisector_properties
problem: The bisector of an angle is the locus of points equidistant from the sides of the angle.

name: basic_construction_problems
problem: To construct a triangle given its three sides, use the method of drawing arcs centered at the endpoints of one side and intersecting them to find the third vertex.

name: construct_angle_congruent
problem: To construct an angle congruent to a given angle, use the method of drawing arcs to transfer the angle to a new position.

name: bisect_angle
problem: To bisect a given angle, draw arcs from the vertex and intersecting points to find the bisector.

name: erect_perpendicular
problem: To erect a perpendicular to a ray at its endpoint, use the method of drawing a semicircle and finding the intersection point.

name: drop_perpendicular
problem: To drop a perpendicular from a point to a line, use the method of drawing arcs and intersecting lines to find the perpendicular.

name: bisect_segment
problem: To bisect a given segment, use the method of drawing arcs from the endpoints and finding the intersection point.

name: angle_sum_triangle
problem: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180°.

name: exterior_angle_triangle
problem: Any exterior angle of a triangle is congruent to the sum of the interior angles not supplementary to it.

name: isosceles_triangle_base_angles
problem: In an isosceles triangle, the angles at the base are congruent.

name: isosceles_triangle_vertex_angle
problem: In an isosceles triangle, the bisector of the vertex angle is also the median and the altitude.

name: isosceles_triangle_symmetry
problem: An isosceles triangle has an axis of symmetry passing through the vertex angle bisector.

name: triangle_congruence_tests
problem: Triangles can be proven congruent using the SAS, ASA, and SSS tests.

name: triangle_inequality
problem: The sum of any two sides of a triangle is greater than the third side.

name: triangle_angle_side_inequality
problem: In a triangle, the side opposite the larger angle is longer.

name: triangle_side_angle_inequality
problem: In a triangle, the angle opposite the longer side is larger.

name: perpendicular_and_slant
problem: The perpendicular dropped from any point to a line is smaller than any slant drawn from the same point to this line.

name: unique_perpendicular
problem: From any point outside a line, there is exactly one perpendicular to the line.

name: perpendicular_bisector_construction
problem: To construct the perpendicular bisector of a segment, draw arcs from the endpoints and find their intersection.

name: angle_bisector_construction
problem: To construct the bisector of an angle, draw arcs from the sides and find their intersection.

problem: To construct a triangle given its three sides, use the method of drawing arcs centered at the endpoints of one side and intersecting them to find the third vertex.

name: perpendicular_erection_construction

name: perpendicular_dropping_construction
problem: To drop a perpendicular from a point to a line, use the method of drawing arcs and intersecting lines to find the perpendicular.

name: segment_bisection_construction
problem: To bisect a given segment, use the method of drawing arcs from the endpoints and finding the intersection point.

problem: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180°.

problem: Any exterior angle of a triangle is congruent to the sum of the interior angles not supplementary to it.

problem: In an isosceles triangle, the angles at the base are congruent.

name: isosceles_triangle_vertex_angle_theorem
problem: In an isosceles triangle, the bisector of the vertex angle is also the median and the altitude.

name: isosceles_triangle_symmetry_theorem
problem: An isosceles triangle has an axis of symmetry passing through the vertex angle bisector.

name: triangle_congruence_tests_theorem

name: triangle_inequality_theorem

problem: In a triangle, the side opposite the larger angle is longer.

problem: From any point outside a line, there is exactly one perpendicular to the line.

name: angle_bisector_construction_theorem
problem: To construct the bisector of an angle, draw arcs from the sides and find their intersection.

problem: To erect a perpendicular to a ray at its endpoint, use the method of drawing a semicircle and finding the intersection point.

problem: To drop a perpendicular from a point to a line, use the method of drawing arcs and intersecting lines to find the perpendicular.

name: segment_bisection_construction_theorem
problem: To bisect a given segment, use the method of drawing arcs from the endpoints and finding the intersection point.

name: parallel_lines_definition
problem: Two lines are called parallel if they lie in the same plane and do not intersect each other.

name: perpendiculars_to_parallel_lines
problem: Two perpendiculars to the same line are parallel to each other.

name: parallel_lines_and_transversal_corresponding_angles
problem: If two lines are intersected by a transversal and corresponding angles are congruent, then the lines are parallel.

name: parallel_lines_and_transversal_alternate_interior_angles
problem: If two lines are intersected by a transversal and alternate interior angles are congruent, then the lines are parallel.

name: parallel_lines_and_transversal_consecutive_interior_angles
problem: If two lines are intersected by a transversal and the sum of consecutive interior angles is 180°, then the lines are parallel.

name: parallel_lines_and_transversal_alternate_exterior_angles
problem: If two lines are intersected by a transversal and alternate exterior angles are congruent, then the lines are parallel.

name: parallel_lines_and_transversal_consecutive_exterior_angles
problem: If two lines are intersected by a transversal and the sum of consecutive exterior angles is 180°, then the lines are parallel.

name: parallel_lines_corresponding_angles_converse
problem: If two lines are parallel, then corresponding angles formed by a transversal are congruent.

name: parallel_lines_alternate_interior_angles_converse
problem: If two lines are parallel, then alternate interior angles formed by a transversal are congruent.

name: parallel_lines_consecutive_interior_angles_converse
problem: If two lines are parallel, then the sum of consecutive interior angles formed by a transversal is 180°.

name: parallel_lines_alternate_exterior_angles_converse
problem: If two lines are parallel, then alternate exterior angles formed by a transversal are congruent.

name: parallel_lines_consecutive_exterior_angles_converse
problem: If two lines are parallel, then the sum of consecutive exterior angles formed by a transversal is 180°.

name: parallel_lines_perpendiculars
problem: If a line is perpendicular to one of two parallel lines, then it is perpendicular to the other.

name: parallelogram_opposite_sides
problem: In a parallelogram, opposite sides are congruent.

name: parallelogram_opposite_angles
problem: In a parallelogram, opposite angles are congruent.

name: parallelogram_consecutive_angles
problem: In a parallelogram, consecutive angles are supplementary.

name: parallelogram_diagonals_bisect
problem: The diagonals of a parallelogram bisect each other.

name: rectangle_properties
problem: A rectangle is a parallelogram with all angles right angles. The diagonals of a rectangle are congruent.

name: rhombus_properties
problem: A rhombus is a parallelogram with all sides congruent. The diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular and bisect the angles.

name: square_properties
problem: A square is a parallelogram with all sides congruent and all angles right angles. The diagonals of a square are congruent and perpendicular, and bisect the angles.

name: trapezoid_definition
problem: A trapezoid is a quadrilateral with exactly one pair of parallel sides.

name: isosceles_trapezoid_properties
problem: An isosceles trapezoid is a trapezoid with congruent non-parallel sides. The base angles of an isosceles trapezoid are congruent.

name: trapezoid_midline
problem: The midline of a trapezoid is parallel to the bases and is congruent to the semisum of the bases.

name: parallelogram_tests
problem: A quadrilateral is a parallelogram if: (1) opposite sides are congruent, or (2) two opposite sides are congruent and parallel, or (3) diagonals bisect each other.

name: trapezoid_tests
problem: A quadrilateral is a trapezoid if it has exactly one pair of parallel sides.

name: isosceles_trapezoid_tests
problem: A trapezoid is isosceles if it has congruent non-parallel sides or congruent base angles.

name: inscribed_angle_definition
problem: An inscribed angle is an angle formed by two chords drawn from the same point on a circle.

name: inscribed_angle_measure
problem: An inscribed angle measures half of the arc it intercepts.

name: inscribed_angles_intercepting_same_arc
problem: All inscribed angles intercepting the same arc are congruent.

name: inscribed_angle_in_semicircle
problem: An inscribed angle intercepting a semicircle is a right angle.

name: angle_formed_by_chord_and_tangent
problem: An angle formed by a chord and a tangent measures half of the intercepted arc.

name: angle_with_vertex_inside_circle
problem: An angle with its vertex inside a circle measures half the sum of the arcs intercepted by the angle and its vertical angle.

name: angle_with_vertex_outside_circle
problem: An angle with its vertex outside a circle measures half the difference of the arcs intercepted by the angle and its vertical angle.

name: angle_sum_of_polygon
problem: The sum of the interior angles of a convex polygon with n sides is (n-2) × 180°.

name: exterior_angle_sum_of_polygon
problem: The sum of the exterior angles of any polygon is 360°.

name: inscribed_polygon_angle_sum
problem: In an inscribed polygon, the sum of opposite angles is 180°.

name: circumscribed_polygon_property
problem: In a circumscribed polygon, the sum of opposite sides is equal.

name: inscribed_angle_and_tangent
problem: An angle formed by a chord and a tangent measures half of the intercepted arc.

name: inscribed_angle_and_chord
problem: An inscribed angle measures half of the arc it intercepts.

name: inscribed_angle_and_semicircle
problem: An inscribed angle intercepting a semicircle is a right angle.

name: inscribed_angle_and_congruent_arcs
problem: Inscribed angles intercepting congruent arcs are congruent.

name: inscribed_angle_and_semicircle_right_angle
problem: An inscribed angle intercepting a semicircle is a right angle.

name: inscribed_angle_and_tangent_chord_angle
problem: An angle formed by a chord and a tangent measures half of the intercepted arc.

name: inscribed_angle_and_vertex_inside_circle
problem: An angle with its vertex inside a circle measures half the sum of the arcs intercepted by the angle and its vertical angle.

name: inscribed_angle_and_vertex_outside_circle
problem: An angle with its vertex outside a circle measures half the difference of the arcs intercepted by the angle and its vertical angle.

name: inscribed_angle_and_polygon_angle_sum
problem: The sum of the interior angles of a convex polygon with n sides is (n-2) × 180°.

name: inscribed_angle_and_polygon_exterior_angle_sum
problem: The sum of the exterior angles of any polygon is 360°.

name: inscribed_angle_and_inscribed_polygon
problem: In an inscribed polygon, the sum of opposite angles is 180°.

name: inscribed_angle_and_circumscribed_polygon
problem: In a circumscribed polygon, the sum of opposite sides is equal.
